client.algorithms

Class InputPDA

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.algorithms.InputPDA

  • public class InputPDA
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to act as a DPDA to work out when there is enough information for a move.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputPDA()
      Constructs a new InputPDA object.

      Resets the DPDA to its initial state and empties the stack.

    • Method Detail

      • transition

        public void transition(java.lang.Integer input)
        Transitions the DPDA according to the input and what the stack contains. This handles transitions for Integer inputs.
        Parameters:
        input - the letter on the input 'tape'.

      • transition

        public void transition(Ticket input)
        Transitions the DPDA according to the input and what the stack contains. This handles transitions for Ticket inputs.
        Parameters:
        input - the letter on the input 'tape'.

      • isAccepted

        public boolean isAccepted()
        Returns true if the DPDA is in an accept state.
        Returns:
        true if the DPDA is in an accept state.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the DPDA to its initial state and empties the stack.

      • createMove

        public Move createMove(Colour colour)
        Creates either a MoveTicket or a MoveDouble from the contents of the stack.
        Parameters:
        colour - the colour of the player whose Move is being made.
        Returns:
        the Move for the specified player.
